Title: Series: Cabinet du Roy
Description: Landscape with, in the left foreground, the Holy Family resting on their flight into Egypt; at left, centre and right, some clumps of trees; after a drawing attributed to Mola Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Anne Claude Philippe de Tubières, Comte de Caylus
Curator's comments: From 'Cabinet du Roy', see 1965,0319.2.1 for comment on the set and on the album. The original drawing is now in the Département des Arts Graphiques, Louvre (Inv. 8411) where it is catalogued as a work by Mola. However, A. Sutherland Harris attributes it to Agostino Carracci. The same composition was engraved for the 'Recueil Jabach' by Massé, as a work after Annibale Carracci (see Stephen Bailey, "Carracci landscape studies: the drawings related to the 'Recueil de 283 Estampes de Jabach'", 1993, No.131, p.468).
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (358)
